node.title: Merkel makes a final appeal for Germans to get vaccinated, citing the bitterness of avoidable deaths.
node.alt: Chancellor Angela Merkel at her official military send-off in Berlin on Thursday. She is leaving office at a time when the pandemic is flaring up in Germany.
node.description: ‘Every shot helps,’ the chancellor said, days before she leaves office.
node.content: ["", "In a final video address before stepping down after 16 years as Germany\u2019s chancellor, Angela Merkel called the coronavirus \u201ctreacherous\u201d and its toll \u201cbitter,\u201d and she pleaded with the unvaccinated to get the shots. ", "\u201cI once again emphatically ask you to take this treacherous virus seriously,\u201d Ms. Merkel said in the last of more than 600 episodes of a video podcast series she began in 2006. \u201cGet vaccinated, whether it\u2019s a first vaccination or a booster. Every shot helps.\u201d ", "So far, 72 percent of the population in Germany have received one dose of the vaccine, and 69 percent are fully vaccinated, according to the Our World in Data project at Oxford University \u2014 a far lower share than many of its neighbors in Western Europe. ", "Ms. Merkel\u2019s plea followed her announcement on Thursday of a partial lockdown targeted to the unvaccinated. The measures are being implemented as Germany\u2019s cases have shot up and deaths have risen amid a Europe-wide surge, and as nations around the world begin confronting the discovery of the new Omicron variant within their borders. ", "Every death \u201cleaves behind families or friends, stunned, speechless and helpless,\u201d Ms. Merkel said in her video statement. \u201cThis is so bitter because it is avoidable.\u201d", "And she warned that the new Omicron variant \u201cappears to be even more contagious than the previous ones.\u201d", "Germany was one of the first countries in Europe to report the detection of the variant, confirming Omicron infections in a married couple who had been in South Africa, where Omicron was identified last week. ", "The chancellor made the announcement about the restrictions alongside Olaf Scholz, the Social Democrat who will officially succeed her in less than a week.", ""]
